responses: 0: Members of the executive violate the constitution whenever they want to, without legal
1: Members of the executive violate most provisions of the constitution without legal consequences, but still must respect certain provisions.
2: Somewhere in between (1) and (3). Members of the executive would face legal consequences
for violating most provisions of the constitution, but can disregard some provisions without
3: Members of the executive rarely violate the constitution, and when it happens they face
4: Members of the executive never violate the constitution.
citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
question: Do members of the executive (the head of state, the head of government, and cabinet ministers) respect the constitution?
